items.item_details:
The Board of Trustees offers an opportunity for the public to address the Board in four sections of the agenda: on matters of concern about Closed Session items; on matters not appearing on the agenda; on action items contained in the Consent Agenda; and prior to voting on any item contained in the Action Agenda. Each speaker is encouraged to submit a comment card to the Board clerk in order to be recognized to speak.
	Per Board Policy, three minutes may be allotted to each speaker with a maximum of 30 minutes per subject. No action or discussion shall be undertaken on any public comments except that members of the Board or its staff may briefly respond to or ask a question for clarification regarding statements made or questions posed by persons addressing the Board under this agenda item.
	For information and disability access to materials, call 408-270-6402. Meetings are held in a location accessible to the disabled.

items.item_details:
The Joint-Use 21st Century Post-Secondary Education Center (JU21-PSEC) is a unique collaboration between the Milpitas Unified School District (MUSD) and the San Jose â  Evergreen Community College District (SJECCD) whereby community college students and eligible high school students learn together. Multiple needs assessment surveys from MUSD students and parents, residents, and local business helped refine the proposed program goals and facility requirements.  
	 
The educational facility programming design incorporated the forward thinking of both districts, reflecting:
	 
Flexible classrooms
Outdoor learning areas
Collaborative spaces
Advanced connectivity and technology
Faculty spaces
Hub for student/teacher impromptu dialogue
Positive presence in the community
LEED Silver construction
	 
Chancellor Rita Cepeda and Superintendent Cary Matsuoka will present an update regarding the JU21-PSEC developments to date.  The presentation will highlight the involvement of the Operations Committee, the Initial Design Committee, and the Educational Programming Committee.

items.item_details: The District employs non-bargaining unit employees in various categories to support programs and services.  These categories are: short-term assignments with limitations as defined in the CSEA/District collective bargaining agreement; substitutes to fill positions for employees on leave of absence or in vacant positions; professional experts with specialized knowledge or expertise not generally required of, or found within, the employee classifications established by the Governing Board; and athletic support staff for athletic activities.

items.item_details: The funds provided through this grant project, Enrollment Growth for Associate Degree Nursing Program, # 15-179-036, is to enhance enrollment and is calculated on additional students the school can serve, and/or to maintain the current student base.  This grant is based on the number of extra students the school can serve above the nursing program's baseline.  No supplanting allowed.  This grant also allocates for remediation and retention needs.  This grant will support continuing grant students over a two year nursing program cycle.  The term of the grant is July 1, 2015 through June 30, 2016.

items.item_details:
In an age of new international tensions and shifting global alliances, the need for Americans to understand international affairs, to recognize cultural values other than their own, and to view the world from a variety of perspectives, has become increasingly critical.  San Jose State University has invited San Jose City College to sponsor two SJCC students’ participation in a Salzburg Global Seminar program focused on Global Citizenship: America and the World in Salzburg, Austria.
	 
The selected San Jose City College students, Trinh (Justin) Cu and Oscar Quiroz-Medrano, will participate in pre-trip activities and attend the Salzburg Global Seminar with 19 students from San Jose State University, and will gain knowledge and skills that will strengthen their ability to live and work in a complex interconnected world. One of the goals of this effort is to support the Internationalization of San Jose City College, and the participating students have committed to work on campus activities to support this goal.
	 
Program Dates: May 29 to June 5, 2015; Faculty Liaison: Mary Conroy
	 
Program expenses: The cost of tuition for the Program in Salzburg including room and board during the seminar will be provided by the SJECCD Foundation’s International Fund. The selected students will be responsible for the cost of transportation to and from Salzburg.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve out-of-country travel for two San Jose City College students to be funded by the SJECCD Foundation.

items.item_details:
AFLiCo stands for French Association for Cognitive Linguistics (AFLiCo). The 6th AFLiCo conference chiefly aims at consolidating and strengthening the network of cognitive linguists working in France and abroad by providing a forum for discussion and collaboration in the tradition of the preceding AFLiCo conferences in Bordeaux (2005), Lille (2007), Nanterre (2009), Lyon (2011) and Lille (2013) and the ‘JET’ workshops in Bordeaux (2010) and Paris (2012 and 2014). Professor Ken Jardin, full-time ESL and French language faculty at Evergreen Valley College, is scheduled to attend the 6th AFLiCo conference on May 26-28, 2015 in Grenoble, France. The conference’s major foci are integrating recent evolutions in consolidating and strengthening the network of cognitive linguists in connection with contiguous fields.
	 
The conference will link cognitive and linguistic topics while taking into account social and cultural contexts, to model or document the integration of social and cultural information into linguistic structures to examine how linguistic variety shapes social and cultural representations. 
	 
Each of these areas is part of a common trend, bringing together social and cognitive science. The 6th AFLICO conference will be about the development of this trend in connection with the framework of Cognitive Linguistics. The topics for 2015 encourage pluridisciplinary work where the following issues are of special importance:
Corpus linguistics, usage-based linguistics, cognitive linguistics: description, models and theories of social and cultural factors.
Usage, norms, rules, regularity: interdisciplinary approaches
Variations in meaning and meaning(s) of variation: impact of variation on the production of meaning
Categorization and prototypes: social and linguistic categorization
Language, culture and ideology: cognitive and cultural models
Cognitive mechanisms underlying the reception and production of indexical meaning
Cross-linguistic variation, intra-linguistic variation and language acquisition
Socio-cognitive approaches to translation and translation teaching 
Professor Jardin will receive $500 in Staff Development Funds to apply toward expenses incurred for this event.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve out of country travel for Professor Kenneth Jardin and approve funds in the amount of $500.00
items.item_text: EVC Out of Country Travel

items.item_details:
The MOU between AACI and SJCC is to establish the term and conditions to work collaboratively to provide the Patient Community Navigator program.
	 
San Jose City College offers a series of courses to train individuals to better understand the complexities of the health care system, and communicate effectively in a variety of situations so they can help patients and their families obtain health care services. Patient Navigators help patients overcome the barriers that keep them from getting timely care. The college-level courses prepare individuals for employment in a health care institution or agency. The Board of Trustees approved the certificate program on January 14, 2014.
	 
Term: The MOU is effective June 1, 2014 through June 30, 2015. This funding approval is for year three of the MOU.
	 
Funding: SJCC will invoice AACI up to an amount of $88,094. This shall include the cost of faculty and support staff, student enrollment fees and other student costs such as supplies, parking and book rental.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the MOU between Asian Americans for Community Involvement (AACI) and the San Jose-Evergreen Community College District-San Jose City College- to partner and provide the Patient Navigator Training Program.
items.item_text: MOU between Asian Americans for Community Involvement and San Jose City College
items.item_text_raw: 12. MOU between Asian Americans for Community Involvement and San Jose City College

items.item_details:
BACKGROUND
The 201-15 budget signed by Governor Brown provided funding on a one-time basis to “create greater incentive for California Community Colleges to develop, enhance, retool, and expand quality career technical education offerings that build upon existing community college regional capacity to respond to regional labor market needs.”  Funds may be used for equipment, curriculum and professional development and “other related costs necessary to develop, enhance, retool, and expand quality career technical education offerings.”
	 
The legislation provided for the funds to be distributed through the regional consortia to their member colleges. The 28-college Bay region will receive a total of $11,316,648. After a 5% set aside for administrative costs, 60% of the remaining funds will be distributed directly to colleges using a formula based on FTES. The remaining $4.3M (approximately 40% of the total allocation) will be utilized to build the capacity of colleges to collaboratively meet regional workforce development needs. $1.3M of this is being directly allocated in equal amounts to each of the colleges to support the work of aligning college CTE programs. $3M will be allocated to multi-college partnerships that commit to collaborative efforts to address regional workforce development needs. 
	 
San Jose City College’s total allocation of the 60% and 40% enhancement shares of this funding is: $232,999
	 
The legislation requires that funds target labor markets where the number of job openings exceeds the supply of candidates from community colleges and from other education and training providers. It also requires that funds be utilized to facilitate alignment of CTE programs across multiple colleges to better serve regional scale industries and labor markets. 
	 
San Jose City College will invest its share of the 60% Enhancement Funds in the amount of $186,570 in the following program areas:
Apprenticeship-Ironworkers
Machine Technologies Advanced Manufacturing
Precision Instrument and Equipment Repair Technician
Apprenticeship-Carpenter/Construction Management
	 
These are one-time funds that must be fully spent by March of 2016. 
San Jose City College will receive an additional allocation of $46,429 from the 40% Enhancement grant by participating in a multi-college collaboration for an Information and Communication Technologies (ICT) Lab.
items.item_recommendation: Board authorization is requested to accept a Career Technical Education (CTE) Enhancement Fund grant in the amount of $232,999.

items.item_details:
On November 11, 2014, the Board of Trustees approved a contract to C. Overaa & Company in the amount of $11,347,704 to provide construction services for the Automotive Technology Building Project at Evergreen Valley College.  
	 
Construction contracts commonly experience unforeseen conditions or District requested design changes that require an adjustment to the contract scope, price and/or duration in the form of a Change Order.  Change Order No. 003 is for the replacement of the existing leaking fire water connection valve, changing the size of the existing main water supply service line, and revisions to structural footings for the hoist cranes and auto alignment racks.  Change Order No. 003 also includes credits for not installing a duplicate fire water post indicator valve and not installing a small section of permanent fencing near the District Warehouse. 
	 
C. Overaa & Company submitted written pricing proposals for these changes (details in the Agenda attachment) that include the applicable increase or decrease in materials, equipment, labor, time extensions, and overhead and profit.  The proposals have been reviewed to ensure the pricing reflects compliance with contract terms.
	 
Original Contract Amount                  $11,347,704
Previous Approved Changes             $     375,005
Change Order No. 003                      $       55,312   
Total Contract and Changes              $11,778,021
	 
The net change to C. Overaa & Company's contract as a result of all changes issued is $430,317, which equates to 3.79% of the original contract.  This change will be funded from project contingency established in the project budget in expectation of this type of change.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Change Order No. 003 in the amount of $55,312 to C. Overaa & Company for the Automotive Technology Building Project #32111 at Evergreen Valley College.
items.item_text: Measure G – 2010 Bond Program: Evergreen Valley College Automotive Technology Building, Project #32111 - C. Overaa & Company Change Order No. 003
items.item_text_raw: 2. Measure G – 2010 Bond Program: Evergreen Valley College Automotive Technology Building, Project #32111 - C. Overaa & Company Change Order No. 003

items.item_details:
The 2025 Facilities Master Plan includes Project-1 "Central Green" and Project-5 "Center for the Arts Plaza and Bus Drop Off", which are further outlined in the “Landscape Programming and Assessment Services – a document prepared by Meyer+Silberberg Landscape Architect, dated June 14, 2013.  These two projects were combined into a single project.  
	 
Two primary areas within the Evergreen Valley College campus are being restored as part of the Central Green / Arts Plaza project.  The Central Green is the central campus gathering space, and the Arts Plaza is the main east entry to the campus.  Central Green restorations include pathways, structural stairways, lighting, upgrades to the Gullo emergency firelane, landscaping, and the addition of a pedestrian pathway between the Gullo firelane and South Campus project.  Arts Plaza restorations will reconfigure plaza spaces to correct Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) compliance deficiencies, the addition of pedestrian drop-off lanes for vehicles, new bus shelters, and structural screening of electrical equipment.
	 
The Board has previously approved a contract to Bellinger Foster Steinmetz (BFS) Landscape Architects to provide design services for the Central Green / Arts Plaza project.  The project was posted on the District’s purchasing website, advertised in local papers on March 10th and 17th, 2015, and published at local builders’ exchanges and plan rooms.  In addition, invitations to bid were sent to over fifty contractors including small, minority and woman-owned firms.  The procurement process for the Central Green / Arts Plaza project was a two-step process and included the pre-qualification of General Contractors, and final bid submission by pre-qualified contractors. 
	 
On May 1, 2015, construction bids were received from the three pre-qualified General Contractors for the Central Green / Arts Plaza project.  Base bids were received as follows:
	 
            Taber Construction, Inc.                $6,775,000
            Gonsalves and Stronck                 $6,977,000
            Swenson and Associates              $7,188,000
	 
Taber Construction, Inc. from Concord, CA was determined to be the lowest responsive and responsible bidder in the amount of $6,775,000.  Alternate bid prices were received for two items totaling $340,000, which are also recommended for award along with the Base Bid. 
	 
The District has not received any bid protests.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the award of a contract in the amount of $7,115,000 to Taber Construction, Inc. for the Central Green / Arts Plaza Project #223 at Evergreen Valley College.

items.item_details:
On April 8, 2014 the Board agreed to enter into a contract with LPAS, Inc. for Professional Services which includes Design Development, Construction Documents, DSA Approval, Bid Documents, Contractor Pre-Qualification, Contractor Selection and Bidding, Construction Administration, and Close-Out/Post-Construction/Occupancy in the amount of $1,474,788  for the Physical Education Building  #122 at San Jose City College.
	 
On October 28, 2014 the Board agreed to amend the agreement in the amount of $74,875 for Site Work Design and Landscape Design.
	 
Amendment #002 includes providing programming and conceptual design services for the siting and installation of three pre-fabricated modular buildings to house a Concession and two visiting team rooms.  LPAS, Inc. submitted written pricing proposals for changes that include additional work.  The proposals have been reviewed to ensure the pricing reflects compliance with contract terms.
	 
The item in this Amendment results in an addition to the contract of $15,000.
	 
         Original Contract Amount       $1,474,788
         Previous Approved Revisions       74,875
         This Revision #002                        15,000
                 
         Total Contract and Changes    $1,564,663

items.item_details:
Following a Request for Qualifications issued by the District, LPAS Architecture + Design was awarded a Master Agreement by the Board of Trustees on December 10, 2014 for Furniture, Fixtures and Equipment Consultant Services.  A proposal was submitted by LPAS for the SJCC Physical Education Building project and reviewed for scope and pricing. The proposed amount for this work is $88,600.00.
	 
The scope of PAA #SJCC-001-FFE includes providing complete FF&E Consulting Services to coordinate and plan the Furniture, Fixtures and  Equipment for the new SJCC Physical Education Building including but not limited to: Provide a complete List of FF&E and Cost Estimates, Furniture and Equipment Plan, Product Selection and Bid Specifications, assist with Procurement, Coordinate Installation and provide final As-Built FF&E plan, Operation & Maintenance Binders and Warranties.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Project Assignment Amendment (PAA) SJCC-01 in the amount of $88,600 to LPAS Architecture + Design, for the SJCC Physical Education Building Project #122 for Furniture, Fixture & Equipment Consultant Services(FF&E).
items.item_text: Measure G - 2004 Bond Program: San Jose City College (SJCC) Physical Education Building Project #122 - LPAS Architecture + Design Project Assignment Amendment (PAA) SJCC-01 .
items.item_text_raw: 5. Measure G - 2004 Bond Program: San Jose City College (SJCC) Physical Education Building Project #122 - LPAS Architecture + Design Project Assignment Amendment (PAA) SJCC-01 .

items.item_details:
The scope of this Agreement is for upgrades to the Heating, Ventilation and Air Conditioning (HVAC) systems on the SJCC campus, including installation of fan coil units in classrooms of the General Education buildings, new air conditioning systems for telecom/data rooms, and new HVAC controls campus wide. The project involves replacing current HVAC components that have reached the end of their useful life and adding new equipment to provide improved thermal comfort in classrooms, and greater efficiency of operation that will minimize maintenance and energy cost for the District. This project also includes upgrades to the Primex clock system including a new transmitter and repeaters to improve communications and provide the campus with new, self adjusting clocks.
	 
The project was posted on the District’s purchasing website and advertised in local papers on April 14, 2015 and April 21, 2015. It was published at local builders’ exchanges and plan rooms.  In addition, invitations to bid were sent to many contractors including small minority and woman-owned firms.  On May 8, 2015 construction bids were received as follows:
	 
           
Company Name                             
Base Bid ($)
Alternates Total ($)        
Total Bid ($)
Environmental Systems, Inc. of N. CA
         933,000 
                 130,900 
            1,063,900 
S & H Construction, Inc.
         978,000 
                 237,000 
            1,215,000 
JKL Construction Services, Inc.
       1,039,185 
                 119,000 
            1,158,185 
Heathron  & Associates Contractors, Inc.
       1,067,140 
                  136,000 
            1,203,140 
					 
Construction Corp.
         843,878 
                 292,019 
            1,135,897 
	 
Environmental Systems Inc. from Santa Clara, California was the lowest responsive and responsible bidder with a base bid in the amount of $933,000.00.  Construction Corp. requested, and was allowed to, withdraw their bid due to a clerical error in their bid, in compliance with Public Contract Code - Section 5101 .
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the award of an Agreement in the amount of $1,063,900 to Environmental Systems, Inc., for the GE HVAC Upgrades Phase I Project #31127 at SJCC.

items.item_details:
On March 11, 2014, the Board of Trustees approved a contract to Kitchell CEM Inc. in the amount of $4,914,192.00 to provide construction services for the Career Technical Education Buildings Project # 31107-2, 100 and 200 Project at SJCC. 
	 
Construction contracts commonly experience unforeseen conditions; District requested or design changes that require an adjustment to the contract, scope, price and/or duration in the form of a Change Order.  Change Order No. 009 is for owner directed changes as well as changes resulting from unforeseen conditions including modifications to new and existing ceiling systems, a temporary power generator for the 200 Building and adjustments to Kitchell's allowable percentage mark-ups for Overhead and Profit and Contractor's Contingency resulting from the removal of the Media Arts Center from their scope of work.  
	 
Kitchell CEM Inc. submitted written pricing proposals for these changes (details in the attachment) that include the applicable increase or decrease in materials, equipment, labor, time extensions and overhead and profit.  The proposals have been reviewed to ensure the pricing reflects compliance with contract terms.
	 
Original Contract Amount                $4,914,192.00
Previous Approved Changes           $   534,659.00
Change Order No. 009                    $   262,602.00
Total Contract and Changes            $5,711,453.00
	 
The net change to Kitchell CEM Inc. contract as a result of all changes issued is $797,261.00 which equates to 16% of the original contract.  This change will be funded from project contingency established in the project budget in expectation of this type of change.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Change Order No. 009 in the amount of $262,602.00 to Kitchell CEM Inc., for the Career Technical Education Buildings 100 and 200 Project at SJCC.

items.item_text_raw: 7. Measure G - 2010 Bond Program: San Jose City College (SJCC) Career Technical Education Project #31107-2 – Buildings 100 & 200 Change Order No. 009 (Final Change Order)

items.item_details:
This agenda item is for the purchase of 86 Uninterruptible Power Supplies (UPSs) for the San Jose City College Network Switch Upgrade project (Bond Project #31702) which was approved at the last Board meeting (5/12/15). This order includes 86 UPSs, external backup batteries, network cards for monitoring and rack mounting kits. The attached quote has the lowest cost found and is based on the only active piggyback bid found to enable us to order these UPSs in time for installation this summer. Transource Computers is the vendor and they are located in Phoenix Arizona. Although the Board has encouraged the district community to refrain from doing business with the State of Arizona, we think that it is in the Districtâs best interest to approve this business transaction because of the financial savings and short timeline to complete this project before students return in the fall.   
	 
Per California Public Contract Code Section 20652, "the governing board of any community college district without advertising for bids, and when the board has determined it to be in the best interest of the district, may authorize by contract, lease, requisition or purchase order ...[to] purchase materials, supplies, equipment ... and other personal property for the district in the manner in which the public corporation or agency is authorized by law to make the lease or purchase." The contract must be based on the same prices and upon the same terms and conditions of a negotiated contract between the supplier and another public corporation agency. 
	 
Therefore, when considering the best interest of the District, it is recommended that the Board of Trustees award a piggybackable  contract between NASPO ValuePoint Cooperative Purchasing Organization (formerly WSCA-NASPO) and Transource Computers without the need to further advertise on an already competitively bid contract. The NASPO ValuePoint Cooperative Purchasing Organization provides the highest standard of excellence in public cooperative contracting by leveraging the leadership and expertise of all states with the purchasing power of their public entities. Attached are an affidavit of publication, Master Price Agreement from NASPO ValuePoint Cooperative Purchasing Organization to Transource Computers that "shall be effective upon approval by the Department of General Services" dated September 15, 2010, Master Price Agreement Number B27177 Amendment Number 5, which extended the expiration date to September 30, 2015, and Quote #225606 from Transource Computers for $146,136.33.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees authorize the District to "piggyback" on a contract with Transource Computers to purchase UPSs for the San Jose City College Network Switch Upgrade for a total cost of $146,136.33.
items.item_text: Measure G-2010 Bond Program: Uninterruptible Power Supplies (UPSs) for San Jose City College Network Switch Upgrade
items.item_text_raw: 8. Measure G-2010 Bond Program: Uninterruptible Power Supplies (UPSs) for San Jose City College Network Switch Upgrade

items.item_details:
Proposition 39 is the California Clean Energy Jobs Act which allocates revenue to the Clean Energy Job Creation Fund for five fiscal years, beginning with fiscal year 2013-14.  Eligible Districts can request funding by submitting an energy expenditure plan application to the California Energy Commission.  The Energy Commission approves plans and works with the California Department of Education which distributes funds after plans have been approved.  The Board has previously approved a contract to Alfa Tech to provide engineering services for the Prop 39, Year 2 LED Lighting Upgrade. 
	 
This project will upgrade existing HID light fixtures to more energy efficient LED Lighting at several locations at the San Jose City and Evergreen Valley Colleges.  Because the estimated project cost was greater than the allocated Prop 39 funding, and to assure a complete set of projects, the campus bond managers agreed to supplement the Prop 39 funds with Measure G-2010 Bond funds.  
	 
The project was posted on the District’s purchasing website, advertised in local papers on April 21st and 28th, and published at local builders’ exchanges and plan rooms.  In addition, invitations to bid were sent to over fifty contractors including small, minority and woman-owned firms.   On May 14, 2015, construction bids were received from the three pre-qualified General Contractors for the Prop 39, Year 2 LED Lighting Upgrade project, as follows:
	 
                ReGreen, Inc.                                $403,198
                Radiant Electric                             $524,500
                ConstructICON Corp (CIC)            $660,255
	 
After thorough technical review by the electrical engineer,  ReGreen, Inc. from Sacramento, CA was determined to be the lowest responsive and responsible bidder.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the award of a contract in the amount of $403,198.00 to ReGreen, Inc. for the Prop 39 Lighting Upgrade Project #25103.
items.item_text: Measure G –2010 Bond Program - Clean Energy Act (Prop 39) Lighting Upgrade Project #25103 - Construction Contract
items.item_text_raw: 9. Measure G –2010 Bond Program - Clean Energy Act (Prop 39) Lighting Upgrade Project #25103 - Construction Contract

items.item_details:
On June 13, 2013 the Board of Trustees approved the Ground Lease and Joint Use Agreement by and between Milpitas Unified School District (MUSD) and San Jose Evergreen Community College District (SJECCD) for the Joint Use 21st Century Post-Secondary Education Center in Milpitas, CA.
	 
MUSD has requested, and SJECCD staff has agreed, to reduce the size of the leased real property from four (4) acres to three (3) acres, based on the current design of the building and site.  This has the effect of reducing the fair market value of the leased real property and, therefore, modifies the assignment of use percentages as defined in the agreement to 40% for MUSD and 60% for SJECCD.
	 
A plat map describing the size and location of the property, along with a legal description, are included as exhibits in the Amendment.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that Board of Trustees approve the First Amendment to Ground Lease and Joint Use Agreement by and between Milpitas Unified School District and San Jose Evergreen Community College District for the Joint Use 21st Century Post-Secondary Education Center #309, Milpitas, CA.

items.item_details: This agenda item is for the purchase of miscellaneous items for the DO Phase II Network Upgrade and Migration project that was approved by the Board on 4/28/15. This purchase includes additional transceivers for the firewalls and switches, a network module to connect the servers, fiber optics cabling, and power management software for the UPSs. The total cost is $17,938.48 per the four attached quotes. This project is based on RFP # G2010.0099 and pursuant to the Master Agreement with Dasher Technologies approved by the Board on 8/26/14.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the purchase of miscellaneous items for the DO Phase II Network Upgrade and Migration project per the attached quotes for a total cost of $17,938.48.

items.item_details:
As part of the accountability measures for the Measure G-2004 Bond Program, the management team for the program has put into place a formal process for managing, tracking and presenting to the Board of Trustees all revisions to the Measure G-2004 individual project names, scopes and budgets.  This process adheres to the accountability standards outlined by Proposition 39 and provides transparency in the evolution of the project list.
	 
This Bond List Revision includes allocation of interest earnings.
	 
Please refer to the attached Bond List Revision Approval Request report for details on the project revision included on the G-2004 Bond List Revision dated May 12, 2015.
	 
This Bond List Revision has been approved by the San Jose City College and Evergreen Valley College Vice Presidents of Administrative Services and the Vice Chancellor of Administrative Services.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees review and approve the revisions to the Measure G - 2004 bond list, as presented.
items.item_text: Measure G-2004 Bond Program: Bond List Revision
items.item_text_raw: 3. Measure G-2004 Bond Program: Bond List Revision

items.item_details:
As part of the accountability measures for the Measure G-2010 Bond Program, the management team for the program has put into place a formal process for managing, tracking and presenting to the Board of Trustees all revisions to the Measure G-2010 individual project names, scopes and budgets.  This process adheres to the accountability standards outlined by Proposition 39 and provides transparency in the evolution of the project list.
	 
Bond List Revision No. 14 includes the following revisions: interest earnings allocations, assignment of project numbers, scope and budget realignment for efficiency in management between San Jose City College’s TBD-3 GE HVAC Upgrades and the District project 39311 Controls Extension Project, renaming of TBD-3 GE HVAC to GE HVAC Upgrade and Campus HVAC Controls Extension, and budget increases to Evergreen Valley College’s 32116 Central Green and San Jose City College’s TBD-3 GE HVAC Upgrades.  The budget increases to these two projects are largely the result of costs coming in higher than anticipated due to current market conditions.  Please note:  32116 Central Green is a split funded project between G-2004 and G-2010, with G-2004 carrying the majority of the budget, and G-2010 carrying the remaining balance of the project.
	 
Please refer to the attached Bond List Revision Approval Request report and the Summary of Current Changes report for details on each project revision included on the G-2010 Bond List Revision No. 14 dated May 26, 2015.
	 
These Bond List Revisions have been approved by the San Jose City College and Evergreen Valley College Vice Presidents of Administrative Services and the Vice Chancellor of Administrative Services.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees review and approve the revisions to the Measure G - 2010 bond list, as presented.

items.item_details:
Per its adopted governing principles, the Board of Trustees will evaluate its performance at the end of each meeting.
		 
The Board will consider two items in discussing its evaluation:
		 
1.To ascertain the effectiveness of the meeting in attaining the advancement of the Board's Global Ends Policy.
		 
2.To ascertain the degree to which Trustees adhered to the Board adopted Governance Principle: Trustees Code of Conduct.
